content.description:
The Fourth Rose always has a way of showing up when least expected but also when most needed. This new line adds another good moderate route to the Left Wing Crag. Stickclip the high first bolt, and engage in some stemming past moves that are easier-than-they-look from the ground. After the ledge, climb some moderate slab to the crux bulge at 2/3 height, and finish at the anchor.

The Fourth Rose is a good route with good moves up great stone, but it's not very sustained. The boulder problem crux is hard to figure out and may seem harder than 5.10 depending ability and figuring out the sequence. Also, the right-trending nature of the line requires it to be followed in order to be cleaned.
content.location:
The Fourth Rose is the furthest route to the left, about 10 feet left of the start to

Alfa Dog

. Don't be the douche that takes the lowering carabiners from the anchor thinking they're booty.

content.description: Beta Chicken tackles the blunt prow of this great wall. With multiple cruxes, the first of which is right off the ground, this sweet line is pretty sustained and rather cryptic. The high first bolt is intended to be stickclipped.
content.protection:
Per

David A. Turner

: eleven bolts plus a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is located to the right of the classic 11a, Alfa Dog.

climbs.name: Alfa Dog
climbs.fa: Bob & Carrie Robertson and Reggie Slavins, 2014

content.description: Alfa Dog is a pretty sweet route. It has multiple but short cruxes, followed by no hands rests. There is a high first bolt, leaving you to stickclip it (my personal choice), place a low 1/2" piece, or go for it.
content.protection: 9 bolts + a 2 bolt anchor (and a 1/2" piece if you so desire).
content.location: It is the first route you come to at Left Wing.
